name: skilful
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 good at doing something, especially because you have practised doing it: Police officers have to be skilful drivers.
Thesaurus: synonyms, antonyms, and examples
good at doing something because of practiceskilfulShe's a skilful driver.skilledHe's a skilled mechanic.good atShe's very good at dealing with people.ableShe's a very able student.giftedShe's a gifted musician.talentedHe's a very talented actor.
See more results »
C1 done or made very well: a skilful piece of playing on the clarinet
More examplesFewer examplesShe gave a characteristically skilful performance.a skilful piece of workThe film is a skilful, witty pastiche of 'Jaws'.Some very skilful negotiators will be needed to settle this dispute.skilful use of language
